description.narrative: 1.3 By 2021, social protection policymakers and practitioners are equipped with knowledge, guidance, tools and mechanisms to effectively implement the reformed social protection policy (combining cash assistance with decentralized care services).

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.3 By 2021, social protection policymakers and practitioners are equipped with knowledge, guidance, tools and mechanisms to effectively implement the reformed social protection policy (combining cash assistance with decentralized care services).

description.narrative: UNICEF Albania has progressed to strengthen policy frameworks, develop partnerships and build local capacities for adequately planning and financing social care services aiming effective reach to families and children living in poverty and vulnerable situations. With UNICEF technical support, government has updated national social protection policy, and almost half of municipalities have an approved and budgeted social care plans. First time, Government allocated additional USD 1.5 million from national social protection budget to be channeled to 14 municipalities for services for most vulnerable population. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2020

title.narrative: Local governments (incl. municipalities) with plans and budgets that reflect community priorities, including prioroties from marginalized groups and children

baseline.value: 7 Local Govermental Units (LGUs) with agreed social plans (unbugdeted)

target.value: 2021:61 LGUs have social care plans budgeted

actual.value: 2020:30 LGUs have approved and budgeted social care plans; 61 LGUs have received training on establishing and operating social fund.

title.narrative: Policies and programmes are influenced by analysis and advocacy to reduce child poverty

baseline.value: Score 1 not yet initiated (Child poverty analyses or advocacy has not yet influenced discussions or activities to introduce, improve or scale-up policies and programmes to reduce child poverty)

target.value: 2021:Score 3 (Policies and programmes have been introduced, improved and scaled-up)

actual.value: 2020:Score 2 INSTAT published data on monetary poverty of children for 2017 and 2018.
